'Putin wants to make Kyiv his dessert': Residents of Ukraine's capital grow anxious under Russian bombs
description: Although long considered the best-protected city in Ukraine, the capital has not been spared from a surge in bombardments now affecting the entire country.

headline: Southern France suffocates under heatwave: 'Every year, it gets worse'

French sports journalist sentenced to seven years in prison in Algeria
description: Christophe Gleizes was investigating the Jeunesse Sportive de Kabylie football club for an article. The Algiers court accused him of having been in contact with one of the club's leaders, who is also at the head of a pro-independence movement.

headline: Two rare fishing cats born in France
description: Two members of this little-known species were born at La Flèche Zoo as part of an offsite conservation program. Fewer than 8,000 of them remain in south and southeast Asia, as their habitat is shrinking rapidly.

headline: Calm, softness and lightness prevail at Paris men's Fashion Week
description: With soft polo shirts, wide-legged trousers and white Bermuda shorts, the shows that closed the Spring-Summer 2026 collections presented in the French capital from June 24 to 29 highlighted a desire for comfort and escape.

headline: 'Queer people have always existed in the countryside': The spread of Pride marches beyond France's big cities
description: After years of LGBTQIA+ activism being concentrated in bigger French cities, more and more rural Pride events are emerging, from small villages to mid-sized towns. Le Monde spoke with several organizations involved in this movement.

The environmental debacle of India's 'Land of the Gods'
description: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (1/6). This is the first part of a series on the Asian mountain range where the continent's main rivers, vital to the survival of nearly 2 billion people, find their source. Climate change and huge infrastructure projects are changing the landscape beyond repair.

headline: Trump forces the rest of the world to exempt US companies from global tax on multinationals
description: Faced with the threat of a tax war from the US government, which considered imposing steep additional taxes on foreign companies operating in the US, the G7 countries agreed to strip much of the substance from the 15% global minimum corporate tax agreement.

headline: The young women enlisting in Ukraine's army: 'In the army, you have to show you've got balls!'
description: Lialia, Veronika and Alina are three women aged 19-24 who have signed up to defend their country. They told Le Monde about their daily lives, what motivates them and the challenges they sometimes face working in such a male-dominated environment.
